If you are contemplating a voyage and you have the means, abandon the venture until your fortunes change. I cannot find a solution that is good (and maybe there is none).\n\nDave Ramsey says borrow the difference so you have a smaller loan, but by the time someone is requesting benevolence, they cannot qualify for borrowing any more.\n\nOther ideas of rolling it into another car loan with incentives aren't great either. [abac08a08b267ab25d1fe30804c835ed].mp3", "__write_download_archive": false}]}, {"id": "de8243e022fbc8efdcdcfba8ccc5da81", "title": "188-Avoiding the Sunk Cost Fallacy by Applying Zero-Based Thinking", "url": "https://traffic.libsyn.com/secure/radicalpersonalfinance/RPF0188-Zero_Based_Thinking.mp3?dest-id=152630", "thumbnail": null, "description": "Years ago, I learned an extremely valuable thinking process from Brian Tracy called Zero-Based Thinking. Today, I share it with you.\n\nHere's the question: Is there anything in your life that, knowning what you now know, you wouldn't get into again today if you had to do it over?\n\nIf the answer is yes, then you follow up with these questions: How do I get out? How fast do I get out?\n\nBy consistently applying this question to every area of our lives, we can avoid much of the impact of the sunk cost fallacy. As humans, we tend to want to keep doing something because we've invested a lot of time, money, or emtion into it in the past.\n\nBut, for the most part, those costs are gone. They're sunk. You can't recover them.\n\nRather, you have to zero the decision out, ignore the past, take the information you have today and determine if you want to continue what you're doing.\n\nThis type of thinking can be extremely challenging and freeing.\n\nI hope it's a useful concept to you!\n\nJoshua\n\n  * Support\u2026", "creator": "Joshua Sheats", "timestamp": 1430791830, "duration": 2404, "series": "Radical Personal Finance", "playlist_count": 1049, "playlist": "Radical Personal Finance", "playlist_id": null, "playlist_title": "Radical Personal Finance", "playlist_uploader": null, "playlist_uploader_id": null, "n_entries": 1049, "webpage_url": "https://podcasts.google.com/feed/aHR0cDovL3JhZGljYWxwZXJzb25hbGZpbmFuY2UubGlic3luLmNvbS9yc3M", "webpage_url_basename": "aHR0cDovL3JhZGljYWxwZXJzb25hbGZpbmFuY2UubGlic3luLmNvbS9yc3M", "webpage_url_domain": "podcasts.google.com", "playlist_index": 855, "__last_playlist_index": 1049, "extractor": "google:podcasts:feed", "extractor_key": "GooglePodcastsFeed", "playlist_autonumber": 855, "display_id": "de8243e022fbc8efdcdcfba8ccc5da81", "fulltitle": "188-Avoiding the Sunk Cost Fallacy by Applying Zero-Based Thinking", "duration_string": "40:04", "upload_date": "20150505", "requested_subtitles": null, "_has_drm": null, "ext": "mp3", "protocol": "https", "resolution": null, "dynamic_range": "SDR", "aspect_ratio": null, "http_headers": {"User-Agent": "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; What You've Got = What You Need\n\nIn order to figure out what you want, simply make a list of everything you want for your family in case of your death.\n\nDivide that list into:\n\n  * Lump Sum needs (immediate cash)\n  * Income needs (ongoing cash)\n\nFor the income needs, decide:\n\n  * How much?\n  * For how long?\n  * Liquidating approach or a non-liquidating approach?\n\nEnjoy the show!\n\nJoshua\n\nLinks:\n\n  * Episode 173: http://radicalpersonalfinance.com/173-economic-basis-of-life-insurance-and-individualfamily-uses-of-life-insurance/\n  * Episode 101: http://radicalperso\u2026", "creator": "Joshua Sheats", "timestamp": 1428526496, "duration": 2699, "series": "Radical Personal Finance", "playlist_count": 1049, "playlist": "Radical Personal Finance", "playlist_id": null, "playlist_title": "Radical Personal Finance", "playlist_uploader": null, "playlist_uploader_id": null, "n_entries": 1049, "webpage_url": "https://podcasts.google.com/feed/aHR0cDovL3JhZGljYWxwZXJzb25hbGZpbmFuY2UubGlic3luLmNvbS9yc3M", "webpage_url_basename": "aHR0cDovL3JhZGljYWxwZXJzb25hbGZpbmFuY2UubGlic3luLmNvbS9yc3M", "webpage_url_domain": "podcasts.google.com", "playlist_index": 866, "__last_playlist_index": 1049, "extractor": "google:podcasts:feed", "extractor_key": "GooglePodcastsFeed", "playlist_autonumber": 866, "display_id": "2925b17ac3bd73075914af1a453d8205", "fulltitle": "178-How Much Life Insurance Do I Need?
